snippet: The South African authorities said they were aware of news media reports that Thamsanqa Jantjie had been accused of murder in 2003.
abstract: South African government says it is looking into claims that Thamsanqa Jantjie, man accused of providing bogus sign language interpretation during Nelson Mandela's funeral, was also once charged with murder and other serious crimes.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The South African authorities said they were aware of news media reports that Thamsanqa Jantjie had been accused of murder in 2003.

headline.main: South Africa Looks Into Claims of Interpreter’s Criminal Past
headline.print_headline: South Africa Looks Into Claims Of Interpreter’s Criminal Past
